overview:
With more than 25 years of experience in wireless and telecommunications, Bob Balascio is uniformly known for advising the highest levels of authority within the mobile industry on all facets of business through finance, sales, marketing and consumer analysis.

He served as a key member of the Verizon strategy team for more than a decade as executive director of strategic planning where he led the integration of insights and dynamic planning processes that served as the basis for executive decision making on corporate strategy, resource allocation and investment framework.

Throughout his career, Bob has been recognized for his ability to build powerful relationships with business partners and customers. He served as president at Bell Atlantic Paging, and as chief information officer at Bell Atlantic Mobile, guiding the company through a period of rapid mobile innovation and several high profile acquisitions that culminated in the landmark GTE and Bell Atlantic merger that created Verizon.

He started his career as an outside plant engineer at New Jersey Bell, and also held positions in the finance, planning and regulatory departments.

Bob serves on the board of directors for several charitable organizations including Daytop New Jersey and The Shepherds of Youth.
